  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.94%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(3)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="90%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:90.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Filing Party:</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.94%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="90%" valign="top" style="border:none;border-bottom:solid windowtext 1.0pt;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:90.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.34%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="4%" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.94%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(4)</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="90%" valign="top" style="border:none;padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:90.72%;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Date Filed:</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr>
  <td width="4%" valign="top" style="padding:0pt 0pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.34%;">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\fc\97154105_D11651_1977152\9991-1-ba.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  7 01:54 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div style="font-family:Times New Roman;">

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="45" height="49" src="g99911bci001.gif" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">APPLE INC.<a name="AppleInc__004455"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">NOTICE OF ANNUAL
MEETING OF SHAREHOLDERS</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To Be Held On May&nbsp;10,
2007<a name="NoticeOfAnnualMeetingOfShareholde_004501"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">To Holders of Common Stock of Apple Inc.:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Notice is hereby given that the Annual Meeting of
Shareholders of Apple Inc., a California corporation (the &#147;<i>Company</i>&#148;),
will be held on Thursday, May&nbsp;10, 2007 at 10:00&nbsp;a.m., local time, at
the Company&#146;s principal executive offices located at 1 Infinite Loop, Building
4, Cupertino, California 95014, for the following purposes, as more fully
described in the accompanying Proxy Statement:</font></p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To
elect the Company&#146;s Board of Directors.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To
approve amendments to the Apple Inc. 2003 Employee Stock Plan. </p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To
approve amendments to the Apple Inc. Employee Stock Purchase Plan.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To
approve amendments to the Apple Inc. 1997 Director Stock Option Plan.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To
ratify the appointment of KPMG LLP as the Company&#146;s independent registered
public accounting firm for fiscal year 2007. </p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To
consider six shareholder proposals if properly presented at the meeting.</p>

<p style="font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>To
transact such other business as may properly come before the meeting and any
postponement(s)&nbsp;or adjournment(s)&nbsp;thereof. </p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All shareholders are cordially invited to attend the
meeting in person. However, to ensure that each shareholder&#146;s vote is counted
at the meeting, shareholders are requested to mark, sign, date and return the
enclosed proxy card as promptly as possible in the envelope provided.
Shareholders attending the meeting may vote in person even if they have
previously returned proxy cards.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Only shareholders of record as of the close of
business on March&nbsp;20, 2007 are entitled to receive notice of, to attend
and to vote at the meeting.</font></p>

<div align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\fc\992046942_D11848_1980953\9991-1-bc.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr  9 20:46 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><img width="45" height="49" src="g99911bei001.gif" alt="GRAPHIC"></font></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="5" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:18.0pt;font-weight:bold;">APPLE
INC.</font></b></p>

<p align="center" style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">1 Infinite Loop<br>
Cupertino, California 95014</font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">PROXY STATEMENT<a name="ProxyStatement_003226"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Introduction<a name="Introduction_003226"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The enclosed proxy is solicited on behalf of the Board
of Directors (the &#147;<i>Board</i>&#148;) of
Apple Inc., a California corporation (the &#147;<i>Company</i>&#148;), for
use at the Company&#146;s annual meeting of shareholders (the &#147;<i>Annual
Meeting</i>&#148;) to be held on Thursday, May&nbsp;10, 2007 at 10:00&nbsp;a.m.,
local time, and at any postponement(s)&nbsp;or adjournment(s)&nbsp;thereof. The
purposes of the Annual Meeting are set forth in this Proxy Statement and in the
accompanying Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareholders. The Annual Meeting will
be held at the Company&#146;s principal executive offices at the address shown
above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company&#146;s complete mailing address is 1 Infinite
Loop, Cupertino, California&#160; 95014, and
its telephone number is (408)&nbsp;996-1010. Georgeson Shareholder
Communications&nbsp;Inc., which is assisting with the mechanics of the return
of the proxies, may be contacted at (800)&nbsp;223-2064.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">These proxy solicitation
materials were first mailed on or about April&nbsp;16, 2007 to all shareholders
entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Procedural Matters<a name="ProceduralMatters_003301"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Only shareholders of record as of the close of business
on March&nbsp;20, 2007 (the &#147;<i>Record Date</i>&#148;)
are entitled to receive notice of, to attend, and to vote at the Annual
Meeting. There were approximately 864,487,955 shares of Common Stock issued and
outstanding on the Record Date, held by approximately 29,861 holders of record.
Each share has one vote on each matter. The closing sale price of Common Stock
as reported on the NASDAQ Global Select Market on the Record Date was $91.48
per share.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">A shareholder may revoke any proxy given pursuant to
this solicitation by attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person, or by
delivering to the Company&#146;s Corporate Secretary at the Company&#146;s principal
executive offices referred to above, prior to the Annual Meeting, a written
notice of revocation or a duly executed proxy bearing a date later than that of
the previously submitted proxy.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company will bear the cost of this solicitation.
The Company has retained the services of Georgeson Shareholder
Communications&nbsp;Inc. to assist in obtaining proxies from brokers and nominees
of shareholders for the Annual Meeting. The estimated cost of such services is
$14,000 plus out-of-pocket expenses. In addition, the Company will reimburse
brokerage firms and other persons representing beneficial owners of shares for
their reasonable expenses in forwarding solicitation material to such
beneficial owners. Certain of the Company&#146;s directors, officers and regular
employees, without additional compensation, may solicit proxies personally or
by telephone, facsimile or email.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Attendance at the Annual
Meeting is limited to shareholders. Admission to the meeting will be on a
first-come, first-served basis. Registration will begin at 9:00&nbsp;a.m. and
each shareholder may be asked to present valid picture identification such as a
driver&#146;s license or passport. Cameras, recording devices and other electronic
devices will not be permitted at the meeting.</font></p>


<br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='',FILE='C:\fc\10011444332_D10180_1981913\9991-1-be.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 01:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Voting of Proxies<a name="VotingOfProxies_003303"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All valid proxies received
prior to the meeting will be voted. All shares represented by a proxy will be
voted, and where a shareholder specifies by means of the proxy a choice with
respect to any matter to be acted upon, the shares will be voted in accordance
with the specification so made. If no choice is indicated on the proxy, the
shares will be voted FOR each of the nominees of the Board (Proposal
No.&nbsp;1), FOR the approval of amendments to the Apple Inc. 2003 Employee
Stock Plan<b>  </b>(Proposal No.&nbsp;2), FOR the
approval of amendments to the Apple Inc. Employee Stock Purchase Plan (Proposal
No.&nbsp;3), FOR the approval of amendments to the Apple Inc. 1997 Director
Stock Option Plan (Proposal No.&nbsp;4), FOR the ratification of the
appointment of KPMG LLP as the Company&#146;s independent registered public
accounting firm for fiscal year 2007 (Proposal No.&nbsp;5), AGAINST each
shareholder proposal, if properly presented at the meeting (Proposals
No.&nbsp;6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 11), and as the proxy holders may determine in
their discretion with respect to any other matters that properly come before
the meeting. See &#147;<b>OTHER MATTERS</b>.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Quorum;
Abstentions; Broker Non-Votes<a name="QuorumAbstentionsBrokerNonvotes_003304"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">In the election of
directors, the seven candidates receiving the highest number of affirmative
votes will be elected as directors. Proposals 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 and 11
each require for approval (i)&nbsp;the affirmative vote of a majority of the
shares &#147;represented and voting&#148; and (ii)&nbsp;the affirmative vote of a
majority of the required quorum. The required quorum for the transaction of
business at the Annual Meeting is a majority of the shares of Common Stock
issued and outstanding on the Record Date. Shares that are voted &#147;FOR&#148;,
&#147;AGAINST&#148; or &#147;ABSTAIN&#148; in a matter are treated as being present at the meeting
for purposes of establishing the quorum, but only shares voted &#147;FOR&#148; or
&#147;AGAINST&#148; are treated as shares &#147;represented and voting&#148; at the Annual Meeting with
respect to such matter. Accordingly, abstentions and broker non-votes will be
counted for purposes of determining the presence or absence of the quorum for
the transaction of business, but will not be counted for purposes of
determining the number &#147;represented and voting&#148; with respect to a proposal.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Voting via the
Internet and by Telephone<a name="VotingViaTheInternetAndByTelephon_003305"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Shareholders whose shares are registered in the name
of a bank or brokerage firm may be eligible to vote electronically through the
Internet or by telephone. A large number of banks and brokerage firms
participate in the ADP Investor Communication Services online program. This
program provides eligible shareholders the opportunity to vote via the Internet
or by telephone. Voting forms will provide instructions for shareholders whose
banks or brokerage firms participate in ADP&#146;s program.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Registered shareholders
may vote electronically through the Internet by following the instructions
included with their proxy card. A shareholder not wishing to vote
electronically through the Internet or whose form does not reference Internet
or telephone voting information should complete and return the enclosed paper
proxy card. Signing and returning the proxy card or submitting the proxy via
the Internet or by telephone does not affect the right to vote in person at the
Annual Meeting.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='2',FILE='C:\fc\10011444332_D10180_1981913\9991-1-be.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 01:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Directors<a name="Directors_003306"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Listed
below are the Company&#146;s seven directors nominated for re-election at the Annual
Meeting. All of the directors elected at the Annual Meeting will serve a
one-year term expiring at the next annual meeting of shareholders.</font></p>

<div align="center">

<table border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="border-collapse:collapse;">

  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">51</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.45pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="29" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2006</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>
 <tr bgcolor="#CCEEFF" style="page-break-inside:avoid;">
  <td width="171" colspan="3" valign="top" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:128.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt 10.0pt;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Jerome B. York</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="213" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:159.65pt;">
  <p align="left" style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:left;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Director</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="15" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:11.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">68</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="5" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:3.6pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="16" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:12.0pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.45pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="29" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:21.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:right;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1997</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="6" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:4.5pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">

</div>

<p style="line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman">&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">William V. Campbell </font></b>has been
Chairman of the Board of Directors of Intuit,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;<i>Intuit</i>&#148;)
since August&nbsp;1998. From September&nbsp;1999 to January&nbsp;2000,
Mr.&nbsp;Campbell acted as Chief Executive Officer of Intuit. From
April&nbsp;1994 to August&nbsp;1998, Mr.&nbsp;Campbell was President and Chief
Executive Officer and a director of Intuit. From January&nbsp;1991 to
December&nbsp;1993, Mr.&nbsp;Campbell was President and Chief Executive Officer
of GO Corporation. Mr.&nbsp;Campbell also serves on the Board of Directors of
Opsware,&nbsp;Inc.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Millard S. Drexler </font></b>has been
Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of J. Crew Group,&nbsp;Inc. since
January&nbsp;2003. Previously, Mr.&nbsp;Drexler was Chief Executive Officer of
Gap Inc. from 1995 and President from 1987 until September&nbsp;2002.
Mr.&nbsp;Drexler was also a member of the Board of Directors of Gap Inc. from
November&nbsp;1983 until October&nbsp;2002.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Albert A. Gore,&nbsp;Jr. </font></b>has
served as a Senior Advisor to Google,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;<i>Google</i>&#148;)
since 2001. He has also served as Executive Chairman of Current TV since 2002
and as Chairman of Generation Investment Management since 2004. He is a
visiting professor at Middle Tennessee State University. Mr.&nbsp;Gore was
inaugurated as the 45th Vice President of the United States in 1993. He was
re-elected in 1996 and served for a total of eight years as President of the
Senate, a member of the Cabinet and the National Security Council. Prior to
1993, he served eight years in the U.S. Senate and eight years in the U.S.
House of Representatives.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Steven P. Jobs </font></b>is one of the
Company&#146;s co-founders and currently serves as its Chief Executive Officer.
Mr.&nbsp;Jobs is also a director of The Walt Disney Company.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Arthur D. Levinson, Ph.D. </font></b>has
been Chief Executive Officer and a Director of Genentech Inc. (&#147;<i>Genentech</i>&#148;) since July&nbsp;1995. Dr.&nbsp;Levinson has been
Chairman of the Board of Directors of Genentech since September&nbsp;1999. He
joined Genentech in 1980 and served in a number of executive positions,
including Senior Vice President of R&amp;D from 1993 to 1995. Dr.&nbsp;Levinson
also serves on the Board of Directors of Google,&nbsp;Inc.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Eric E. Schmidt, Ph.D. </font></b>has
served as the Chief Executive Officer of Google since July&nbsp;2001 and as a
member of Google&#146;s Board of Directors since March&nbsp;2001, where he served as
Chairman of the Board from March&nbsp;2001 to April&nbsp;2004. In
April&nbsp;2004, Dr.&nbsp;Schmidt was named Chairman of the Executive Committee
of Google&#146;s Board of Directors. From April&nbsp;1997 to November&nbsp;2001,
Dr.&nbsp;Schmidt served as Chairman of the Board of Directors of
Novell,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;<i>Novell</i>&#148;), a
computer networking company, and, from April&nbsp;1997 to July&nbsp;2001, as
the Chief Executive Officer of Novell. Dr.&nbsp;Schmidt was a director of
Siebel Systems,&nbsp;Inc. until January&nbsp;2006.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Jerome B.
York </font></b>has been Chief Executive Officer of Harwinton Capital
Corporation, a private investment company that he controls, since
September&nbsp;2003. From January&nbsp;2000 until September&nbsp;2003, </p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='3',FILE='C:\fc\10011444332_D10180_1981913\9991-1-be.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 01:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Mr.&nbsp;York
was Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of MicroWarehouse,&nbsp;Inc., a
reseller of computer hardware, software and peripheral products. From
September&nbsp;1995 to October&nbsp;1999, he was Vice Chairman of Tracinda
Corporation. From May&nbsp;1993 to September&nbsp;1995 he was Senior Vice
President and Chief Financial Officer of IBM Corporation (&#147;<i>IBM</i>&#148;),
and served as a member of IBM&#146;s Board of Directors from January&nbsp;1995 to
August&nbsp;1995. Mr.&nbsp;York is also a director of Tyco International Ltd.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Role of the Board;
Corporate Governance Matters<a name="RoleOfTheBoardCorporateGovernance_003404"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">It is the paramount duty of the Board to oversee the
Chief Executive Officer and other senior management in the competent and
ethical operation of the Company on a day-to-day basis and to assure that the
long-term interests of the shareholders are being served. To satisfy this duty,
the directors take a proactive, focused approach to their position, and set
standards to ensure that the Company is committed to business success through
maintenance of the highest standards of responsibility and ethics.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Members of the Board bring to the Company a wide range
of experience, knowledge and judgment. These varied skills mean that governance
is far more than a &#147;check the box&#148; approach to standards or procedures. The
governance structure in the Company is designed to be a working structure for
principled actions, effective decision-making and appropriate monitoring of
both compliance and performance. The key practices and procedures of the Board
are outlined in the Corporate Governance Guidelines available on the Company&#146;s
website at www.apple.com/investor.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board met a total of five
times during fiscal year 2006. The Board has determined that all Board members,
excluding Steve Jobs, are independent under the applicable National Association
of Securities Dealers rules.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Board Committees<a name="BoardCommittees_003406"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Board has a
standing Compensation Committee, a </font>Nominating</font> and
Corporate Governance Committee (&#147;<i><font style="font-style:italic;">Nominating Committee</font>&#148;</i>) and an Audit and Finance
Committee (&#147;<i>Audit Committee</i>&#148;). All committee members
are independent under the listing standards of the NASDAQ Global Select Market.
The members of the committees are identified in the table below.</p>

<div align="center">

  <td width="21" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:16.0pt;">

  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>

</table>

</div>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:1.0pt;line-height:1.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Audit Committee is primarily responsible for overseeing the services
performed by the Company&#146;s independent registered public accounting firm and
internal audit department, evaluating the Company&#146;s accounting policies and its
system of internal controls and reviewing significant financial transactions.
Members of the Audit Committee are Messrs.&nbsp;Campbell and York and
Dr.&nbsp;Levinson. The Audit Committee met a total of 12 times during fiscal
year 2006.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Compensation Committee is primarily responsible for reviewing the
compensation arrangements for the Company&#146;s executive officers, including the
Chief Executive Officer, and for administering the Company&#146;s equity
compensation plans. Members of the Compensation Committee are
Messrs.&nbsp;Campbell, Drexler, and Gore. The Compensation Committee met a
total of three times during fiscal year 2006.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">4</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='4',FILE='C:\fc\10011444332_D10180_1981913\9991-1-be.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 01:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Nominating Committee assists the Board in identifying qualified
individuals to become directors, determines the composition of the Board and
its committees, monitors the process to assess Board effectiveness and helps
develop and implement the Company&#146;s corporate governance guidelines. The
Nominating Committee also considers nominees proposed by shareholders. Members
of the Nominating Committee are Messrs.&nbsp;Drexler and Gore and
Dr.&nbsp;Levinson. The Nominating Committee met a total of seven times during
fiscal year 2006 and met subsequent to the end of the last fiscal year to
recommend to the full Board each of the nominees for election to the Board of
Directors, as presented herein.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Audit, Compensation and Nominating Committees operate under written
charters adopted by the Board. These charters are available on the Company&#146;s website
at www.apple.com/investor.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">During fiscal year 2006,
each member of the Board of Directors attended or participated in seventy-five
percent (75%) or more of the aggregate of (i)&nbsp;the total number of meetings
of the Board of Directors held during the fiscal year or the portion thereof
following such person&#146;s appointment to the Board and (ii)&nbsp;the total number
of meetings held by all committees on which such Director served during the
past fiscal year or the portion thereof following such person&#146;s appointment to
one or more of those committees. There are no family relationships among
executive officers or Directors of the Company.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Audit Committee
Financial Expert<a name="AuditCommitteeFinancialExpert_003527"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">All members of the Company&#146;s Audit
Committee, Messrs.&nbsp;Campbell and York and Dr.&nbsp;Levinson, qualify as
&#147;audit committee financial experts&#148; as defined by the Securities and Exchange
Commission (the &#147;<i>SEC</i>&#146;&#146;) and also meet the
additional criteria for independence of Audit Committee members set forth in
Rule&nbsp;10A-3(b)(l) under the Exchange Act.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Code of Ethics<a name="CodeOfEthics_003527"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company has a code of
ethics that applies to all of the Company&#146;s employees, including its principal
executive officer, principal financial officer and principal accounting
officer, and its Board. A copy of this code, &#147;Ethics: The Way We Do Business
Worldwide,&#148; is available on the Company&#146;s website at www.apple.com/investor.
The Company intends to disclose any changes in or waivers from its code of
ethics by posting such information on its website or by filing a Form&nbsp;8-K.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Director
Compensation<a name="DirectorCompensation_003528"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The form and amount of
director compensation are determined by the Board after a review of
recommendations made by the Nominating Committee. The current practice of the
Board is to base a substantial portion of a director&#146;s annual retainer on
equity. In 1998, shareholders approved the 1997 Director Stock Option Plan (the
&#147;<i>Director Plan&#148;</i>) and 1,600,000
shares were reserved for issuance thereunder on a stock split-adjusted basis.
Pursuant to the Director Plan, the Company&#146;s non-employee directors are granted
an option to acquire 30,000 shares of Common Stock upon their initial election
to the Board (&#147;<i>Initial Options&#148;</i>).
The Initial Options vest and become exercisable in three equal annual
installments on each of the first through third anniversaries of the grant
date. On the fourth anniversary of a non-employee director&#146;s initial election
to the Board and on each subsequent anniversary thereafter, the director will
be entitled to receive an option to acquire 10,000 shares of Common Stock (&#147;<i>Annual Options&#148;</i>). Annual Options are fully
vested and immediately exercisable on their date of grant. As of the end of
fiscal year 2006, there were options for 760,000 shares outstanding under the
Director Plan. Since accepting the position of CEO, Mr.&nbsp;Jobs is no longer
eligible for grants under the Director Plan. Non-employee directors also
receive a $50,000 annual retainer paid in quarterly increments. In addition,
directors receive up to two free computer systems per year and are eligible to
purchase additional equipment at a discount. Directors do not receive any
additional consideration for serving on committees or as a committee
chairperson.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">5</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='5',FILE='C:\fc\10011444332_D10180_1981913\9991-1-be.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 01:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Communications with
the Board<a name="CommunicationsWithTheBoard_003529"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company does not have formal procedures for
shareholder communication with the Board. Any matter intended for the Board, or
for any individual member or members of the Board, should be directed to the
Company&#146;s Corporate Secretary at 1 Infinite Loop, Cupertino, California 95014,
with a request to forward the same to the intended recipient. In general, all
shareholder communication delivered to the Company&#146;s Corporate Secretary for
forwarding to the Board or specified Board members will be forwarded in
accordance with the shareholder&#146;s instructions. However, the Company&#146;s
Corporate Secretary reserves the right not to forward to Board members any
abusive, threatening or otherwise inappropriate materials. Information
regarding the submission of comments or complaints relating to the Company&#146;s
accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters can be found on
the Company&#146;s website at www.apple.com/investor.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The Company encourages all
incumbent directors and nominees for election as director to attend the Annual
Meeting. Then-current directors Steve Jobs, William Campbell and Fred Anderson
attended the Annual Meeting in April&nbsp;2006.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation
Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation<a name="CompensationCommitteeInterlocksAn_003531"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The current members of the
Compensation Committee are Messrs.&nbsp;Campbell, Drexler and Gore, none of
whom are employees of the Company and all of whom are considered &#147;independent&#148;
directors under the applicable NASD listing standards. There were no interlocks
or insider participation between any member of the Board or Compensation
Committee and any member of the board of directors or compensation committee of
another company.</font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Executive Officers<a name="ExecutiveOfficers_003531"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following sets forth certain information regarding
executive officers of the Company. Information pertaining to Mr.&nbsp;Jobs, who
is both a director and an executive officer of the Company, may be found in the
section entitled &#147;<b>Directors</b>.&#148;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Timothy D. Cook, </font></b>Chief
Operating Officer (age 46), joined the Company in March&nbsp;1998.
Mr.&nbsp;Cook also served with the Company as Executive Vice President,
Worldwide Sales and Operations from 2002 to 2005. In 2004, his responsibilities
were expanded to include the Company&#146;s Macintosh hardware engineering. From
2000 to 2002, Mr.&nbsp;Cook served in the role of Senior Vice President,
Worldwide Operations, Sales, Service and Support. From 1998 to 2000,
Mr.&nbsp;Cook served in the position of Senior Vice President, Worldwide
Operations. Prior to joining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Cook held the position of
Vice President, Corporate Materials for Compaq Computer Corporation (&#147;<i>Compaq&#148;</i>). Previous to his work at Compaq,
Mr.&nbsp;Cook was the Chief Operating Officer of the Reseller Division
at Intelligent Electronics. Mr.&nbsp;Cook also spent 12&nbsp;years with IBM,
most recently as Director of North American Fulfillment. Mr.&nbsp;Cook also
serves as a member of the Board of Directors of Nike,&nbsp;Inc.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Anthony Fadell, </font></b>Senior
Vice President, iPod Division (age 38), joined the Company in 2001. From 2004
to April&nbsp;2006, Mr.&nbsp;Fadell was Vice President of iPod Engineering.
From 2001 to 2004, Mr.&nbsp;Fadell was the Senior Director of the Company&#146;s
iPod Engineering Team. Prior to joining Apple, Mr.&nbsp;Fadell was a
co-founder, CTO, and director of engineering of the Mobile Computing Group at
Philips Electronics where he was responsible for all aspects of business and
product development for a variety of products. Mr.&nbsp;Fadell later became VP
of Business Development for Philips U.S. Strategy&nbsp;&amp; Ventures, focusing
on building the company&#146;s digital media strategy and investment portfolio.
Prior to joining Philips, Mr.&nbsp;Fadell was a hardware and software architect
at General Magic.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">6</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='6',FILE='C:\fc\10011444332_D10180_1981913\9991-1-be.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 01:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Ronald B. Johnson, </font></b>Senior
Vice President, Retail (age 48), joined the Company in January&nbsp;2000. Prior
to joining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Johnson spent 16&nbsp;years with Target
Stores, most recently as Senior Merchandising Executive.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Peter Oppenheimer, </font></b>Senior
Vice President and Chief Financial Officer (age 44), joined the Company in
July&nbsp;1996. Mr.&nbsp;Oppenheimer also served with the Company in the
position of Vice President and Corporate Controller, and as Senior Director of
Finance for the Americas. Prior to joining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Oppenheimer
was CFO of one of the four business units for Automatic Data Processing,&nbsp;Inc.
(&#147;<i>ADP&#148;</i>). Prior to joining ADP,
Mr.&nbsp;Oppenheimer spent six years in the Information Technology Consulting
Practice with Coopers and Lybrand.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Donald J. Rosenberg, </font></b>Senior
Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary (age 56), joined the Company in
December&nbsp;2006. Prior to joining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Rosenberg spent 31
years with IBM, most recently as Senior Vice President and General Counsel.
Prior to that he held a number of senior positions at IBM, including over ten
years as Vice President and Assistant General Counsel for litigation.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Philip W. Schiller, </font></b>Senior
Vice President, Worldwide Product Marketing (age 46), rejoined the Company in
1997. Prior to rejoining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Schiller was Vice President of
Product Marketing at Macromedia,&nbsp;Inc. from December&nbsp;1995 to
March&nbsp;1997, and was Director of Product Marketing at FirePower
Systems,&nbsp;Inc. from 1993 to December&nbsp;1995. Prior to that,
Mr.&nbsp;Schiller spent six years at the Company in various marketing
positions.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Bertrand Serlet, Ph.D., </font></b>Senior
Vice President, Software Engineering (age 46), joined the Company in
February&nbsp;1997 upon the Company&#146;s acquisition of NeXT. At NeXT,
Dr.&nbsp;Serlet held several engineering and managerial positions, including
Director of Web Engineering. Prior to NeXT, from 1985 to 1989, Dr.&nbsp;Serlet
worked as a research engineer at Xerox PARC.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-weight:bold;">Sina
Tamaddon, </font></b>Senior Vice President, Applications (age 49),
joined the Company in September&nbsp;1997. Mr.&nbsp;Tamaddon has also served
with the Company in the position of Senior Vice President, Worldwide Service
and Support, and Vice President and General Manager, Newton Group. Before
joining the Company, Mr.&nbsp;Tamaddon held the position of Vice President,
Europe with NeXT from September&nbsp;1996 through March&nbsp;1997. From
August&nbsp;1994 to August&nbsp;1996, Mr.&nbsp;Tamaddon held the position of
Vice President, Professional Services with NeXT.</p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">7</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='7',FILE='C:\fc\10011444332_D10180_1981913\9991-1-be.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 01:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Security Ownership
of Certain Beneficial Owners and Management<a name="SecurityOwnershipOfCertainBenefic_003557"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following table
sets forth certain information as of March&nbsp;20, 2007 (the &#147;<i>Table Date</i>&#148;) with respect to the
beneficial ownership of the Company&#146;s Common Stock by (i)&nbsp;each person the
Company believes beneficially holds more than 5% of the outstanding shares of
Common Stock; (ii)&nbsp;each director; (iii)&nbsp;each Named Executive Officer
listed in the Summary Compensation Table under the heading &#147;<b><font style="font-weight:bold;">Information Regarding </font>Executive
Compensation;</b>&#148; and (iv)&nbsp;all directors and executive officers as
a group. On the Table Date, approximately 864,487,955 shares of Common Stock
were issued and outstanding. Unless otherwise indicated, all persons named as <font style="letter-spacing:-.1pt;">beneficial owners of Common Stock have sole voting
power and sole investment power with respect to the shares indicated as
beneficially owned. In addition, unless otherwise indicated, all persons named
below can be reached at Apple Inc., 1 Infinite Loop, Cupertino, California
95014.</font></font></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Security
Ownership of 5% Holders, Directors, Nominees and Executive Officers<a name="SecurityOwnershipOf5HoldersDirect_003601"></a></font></b></p>

  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
  <td width="2" valign="bottom" style="padding:0pt .7pt 0pt 0pt;width:1.7pt;">
  <p style="margin:0pt 0pt .0001pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:1.0pt;">&nbsp;</font></p>
  </td>
 </tr>

shares of Common Stock held and options held by such individuals that were
exercisable at the Table Date or within 60&nbsp;days thereafter. This does not
include options or restricted stock units that vest more than 60 days after the
Table Date. The share numbers have been adjusted to reflect the Company&#146;s
two-for-one stock split in February&nbsp;2005.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(2) Based
on a Form&nbsp;13G/A filed February&nbsp;14, 2007 by FMR Corp. FMR Corp. lists
its address as 82&nbsp;Devonshire Street, Boston, MA 02109, in such filing.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(3) Includes
120,000 shares of Common Stock that Mr.&nbsp;Jobs has the right to acquire by
exercise of stock options.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(4) Includes
220,000 shares of Common Stock that Mr.&nbsp;Campbell has the right to acquire
by exercise of stock options.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(5) Excludes
600,000 unvested restricted stock units.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(6) Includes

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(7) Consists
of 70,000 shares of Common Stock that Mr.&nbsp;Gore has the right to acquire by

 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">8</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(8) Includes

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>(9) Includes

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(10) Excludes
450,000 unvested restricted stock units.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(11) Excludes
400,000 unvested restricted stock units.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(12) Consists
of 12,284 shares of Common Stock that Dr.&nbsp;Schmidt holds indirectly.
Dr.&nbsp;Schmidt has declined to participate in the 1997 Director Stock Option
Plan.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(13) Includes
40,000 shares of Common Stock that Mr.&nbsp;York has the right to acquire by
exercise of stock options.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;"> </font>(14) Includes
2,233,683 shares of Common Stock that executive officers or directors have the
right to acquire by exercise of stock options and excludes 2,700,000 unvested
restricted stock units.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 20.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">*</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Represents
less than 1% of the issued and outstanding shares of Common Stock on the Table
Date.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;Beneficial
Ownership Reporting Compliance<a name="Section16abeneficialOwnershipRepo_003758"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as
amended, requires the Company&#146;s executive officers and directors, and persons
who own more than ten percent of a registered class of the Company&#146;s equity
securities, to file reports of securities ownership and changes in such
ownership with the SEC. Executive officers, directors and greater than ten
percent shareholders also are required by rules&nbsp;promulgated by the SEC to
furnish the Company with copies of all Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;forms they file.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Based solely upon a review of the copies of
such forms furnished to the Company or written representations that no Forms 5
were required, the Company believes that all Section&nbsp;16(a)&nbsp;filing
requirements were met during fiscal year 2006, except for the following: (i)&nbsp;one
Form&nbsp;4 was filed for Arthur D. Levinson on August&nbsp;17, 2006 to report
an automatic stock option grant under the Company&#146;s 1997 Director Stock Option
Plan made on August&nbsp;14, 2006; and (ii)&nbsp;one Form&nbsp;4 was filed for
Anthony Fadell on September&nbsp;1, 2006 with respect to the purchase and sale
by Mr.&nbsp;Fadell&#146;s trust of 300 and 25 shares, respectively, of the Company&#146;s
Common Stock in June&nbsp;2006 and August&nbsp;2006.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">9</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='9',FILE='C:\fc\10011444332_D10180_1981913\9991-1-be.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 01:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-align:center;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">REPORT OF THE
COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF<a name="ReportOfTheCompensationCommitteeO_003807"></a><br>
DIRECTORS ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION</font></b></p>

<p style="font-style:italic;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The following report of the Compensation Committee of
the Board of Directors shall not be deemed &#147;soliciting material&#148; or to be
&#147;filed&#148; with the Securities and Exchange Commission, nor shall such information
be incorporated by reference into any future filing under the Securities Act of
1933 or Securities Exchange Act of 1934, each as amended, except to the extent
that the Company specifically incorporates it by reference into such filing.</font></i></p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Compensation
Committee / Corporate Governance<a name="CompensationCommitteeCorporateGov_003810"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Purpose.</font></b></font><b>&nbsp;&nbsp; </b>Responsibilities
of the Compensation Committee of the Board (the &#147;<i>Committee</i>&#148;)
are to:&#160; 1) establish and modify
compensation and incentive plans and programs for all employees of the Company,
including executive officers; 2) review and approve compensation and awards
under compensation and incentive plans and programs for executive officers of
the Company; and 3) act as the administering committee for equity compensation
plans as designated by the Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Member independence.</font></b></font><b>&nbsp;&nbsp; </b>Three
non-employee directors serve on the Committee: Messrs.&nbsp;Campbell, Drexler
and Gore. They are independent directors as determined in accordance with
various NASDAQ and SEC rules. Director independence is reviewed annually by the
full Board.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Charter.</font></b></font><b>&nbsp;&nbsp; </b>The
Committee&#146;s role is to work with executive management in developing a
compensation philosophy; to evaluate and approve compensation for the Chief
Executive Officer (the &#147;<i>CEO</i>&#148;),
executive officers, and key executives; and to oversee the Company&#146;s employee
equity compensation plan and employee stock purchase plan. The Committee&#146;s
charter is available on the Company&#146;s website at www.apple.com/investor.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Oversight of compensation related disclosures.</font></b></font><b>&nbsp;&nbsp; </b>The Committee
is responsible for overseeing the Company&#146;s executive compensation-related
disclosures. The SEC issued new rules&nbsp;in August&nbsp;2006 for executive
compensation and related party disclosure. The new rules&nbsp;do not apply to
this Proxy Statement, but they will be effective for Apple&#146;s proxy statement
for fiscal year 2007.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Independent consultants and advisors.</font></b></font><b>&nbsp;&nbsp; </b>The Committee
has the authority to retain and terminate any independent, third-party
compensation consultant and to obtain advice and assistance from internal and
external legal, accounting and other advisors. During fiscal year 2006, the
Committee engaged Frederic W. Cook&nbsp;&amp; Co.,&nbsp;Inc. (&#147;<i>F.W. Cook</i>&#148;) to advise on compensation matters. F.W. Cook has
not provided any other services to the Company and has received no compensation
other than with respect to the services provided to the Committee.</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Committee meetings.</font></b></font><b>&nbsp;&nbsp; </b>Each year,
the Committee develops a quarterly agenda for the coming year. The Chair
reports the Committee&#146;s actions and recommendations to the full Board following
each Committee meeting. The Committee held seven formal meetings during fiscal
year 2006. Each meeting included time for a private session, during which only
the independent directors and their advisors, if invited, were present. The
executive officers, with the exception of the CEO, play no role and provide no
recommendations with respect to the Company&#146;s compensation programs, practices
and packages for executives, other employees or directors. The CEO is consulted
when the Committee reviews performance of other executive officers. Further,
the Committee discusses the CEO&#146;s compensation package with him but he is not
present when pay decisions regarding his own compensation are made.</p>

<p style="font-weight:bold;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 10.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:-10.0pt;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Objectives of the
Company&#146;s Compensation Program<a name="ObjectivesOfTheCompanysCompensati_003814"></a></font></b></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">It is the Company&#146;s objective and philosophy to align compensation
programs with shareholders&#146; interests and the Company&#146;s business objectives,
reward outstanding performance, be externally competitive and internally
equitable, and retain entrepreneurial and innovative top talent on a long-term </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">10</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='10',FILE='C:\fc\10011444332_D10180_1981913\9991-1-be.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Apr 10 01:15 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman"><font style="font-size:10.0pt;">basis. This is achieved through a
straightforward compensation package that relies on equity compensation and
limits cash compensation and perquisites</font><b>.</b></font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font style="font-weight:bold;"><b><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Executive Officer Benchmarking / Peer Groups.</font></b></font><b>&nbsp;&nbsp; </b>The
compensation of the CEO and other executive officers was compared by the
Committee&#146;s consultants to data from peer group companies and from published
survey data. To identify appropriate peer group companies, management, the
Committee and the Committee&#146;s consultants mutually developed the following
selection criteria:</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">1.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Labor market
and capital market competitors;</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">2.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>High technology
and retail companies (the latter for the Senior Vice President, Retail only);
and</p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 6.0pt 40.0pt;text-indent:-20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">3.</font><font size="1" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:3.0pt;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; </font>Similar pay
models and growth experiences.</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:20.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">The fiscal year 2006
peer group companies identified to benchmark all executive officers with the
exception of the Company&#146;s Senior Vice President, Retail included:</font></p>
